title: Edit a company record
content:
If you are using Customer Service Management (CSM), skip this page and see View or edit company, it covers CSM-specific company details.

To edit a company record:

  1. From the main menu, select Plan > Company.

  2. Select the company record you want to edit.

  3. Click the name of the selected record to display it.

  4. By default, the company record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view.

    Tab Description
    General Displays general information about the current record. For more information about the General tab, see the General tab section.
    Workflow Displays the workflow metaphase and phase for the current record. For more information about workflow, see Company workflow.
    Related contracts

    Displays the details of the contracts with the company, including the type of contract, the phase of the contract, and the expiry date of the contract.

    The number of active contracts with the company is displayed on the tab in parentheses.

    For more information about contracts, see Contract Management.
    Managed customer

    The Managed customer tab appears only if you are working in a multi-tenant (MT) environment on the provider tenant.

    Displays the details of the managed customer's tenant and users who have access to the managed customer's records. For details, see  the Managed customer tab section.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the current record. For more information about discussions, see Discussions.
    History Displays changes to the selected record. For more information about history, see History.

  5. Click   Save on the toolbar.

You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right. For more information, see Mass update.

General tab

This tab includes the following sections:

Section Description
Company details Name The name of the company.
DUNS number The company's unique identification number—provided by the company.
Code The Service Management identification code for the company.
Company type The type of company.

If this company is a managed customer in an MT environment, the Company type must be Customer.
Logo The company logo. Click Upload image to upload the logo image.
Caution note Cautionary notes about the company. This field is mandatory when the company is in the Caution phase.

Available: When the company is in the Caution or Inactive phases.
To display more details, click Show more.
Description A description about the company; for example, your relationship, services provided, and so on.
Web site The URL for the company's official Web site.
Phone The company's telephone number.
Email The company's main email address.
Fax The company's fax number.
Account team
The team from your organization responsible for managing the business relationship with the customer company and maintaining its information in the application.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Support team
The team from your organization responsible for providing technical assistance, troubleshooting, and customer support to the customer company.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Primary customer contact
The main point of contact within the customer company responsible for communicating updates to company information, handling escalations, and coordinating with your organization.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Security contact
The person from the customer company responsible for security-related communications.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Industry The sector in which the company operates. The available options are: Finance, Healthcare, and Technology.
Time zone The time zone in which the company operates. Used for scheduling meetings, determining support availability, and ensuring service delivery aligns with business hours.
Grace period (days) The additional number of days provided beyond the due date before suspensions or terminations take effect.
Domain The official web domain associated with the company.
External reference The unique identifier or reference number used for mapping the company record with external systems.
Allow surveys
Specifies whether the company allows surveys or feedback requests for customer satisfaction or market research.
This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Allow notifications
Specifies whether the company allows notifications, alerts, or updates related to account activity, events, or cases. This field is relevant only for customer companies.
Contacts Contact your tenant administrator to enter the company contacts into the system, selecting the company's name in the Company field. These contacts automatically appear under the company's Contacts section.
Brands Brands for this company. For more information, see Brands.
Sites Contact your tenant administrator to enter the sites into the system in the Locations module.
  • To select one of the sites as the company's headquarters, select the site and click Set as Headquarters  .
  • To remove the Headquarters tag from a site marked Headquarters, select the site and click Remove Headquarters  .

Managed customer tab

The Managed customer tab appears only in shared service environments when the tenant is a provider tenant.

Section Description
Managed tenant details Managed customer The selected check box indicates that this company is a managed customer.
Code The company's unique identification number. A three character alphanumeric, uppercase code used to identify the customer. This code appears in the MT Console as the prefix to all incidents and requests belonging to this customer. It's synchronized from Suite Administration.
Customer tenant A drop-down list of tenants that have been identified as your managed customers. Select one of the Tenant IDs as the managed customer. A tenant can be selected only for a single company at a given time.
Customer tenant URL The value of this field is automatically populated by the URL for the customer selected as a Tenant. It can be edited if necessary.
Users with access Displays MT agents details for this managed customer. This section appears only for shared service admin users.
Filter users already added to those users with access to this managed customer's data.

Related topics

  • How to create a company record
  • Company workflow
  • Contract Management
  • Locations
